Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Palustrin-2ISc (ranatuerin-2-AW, R2AW; Odorranain-F-OR1; UCSS1a; XXU; 1S=S, natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals; Inactive: Palustrin-2ISd)
Sequence Information.Source: Odorrana ishikawae, Japan;Odorrana wuchuanensis, China, Asia. skin secretion, the Wuyi torrent frog,Amolops wuyiensis, UK market

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active against Gram- bacteria E. coli (MIC 14.5 ug/ml), B. pyocyaneus (now called P. aeruginosa) (MIC 14.5 ug/ml), Gram+ bacteria S. aureus (MIC 7.3 ug/ml), and yeast C. albicans (MIC 14.5 ug/ml). Found in multiple species. Also see Yang X et al. 2011 J Proteome Res. in press. Active against E. coli (MIC 100 uM), S. aureus (25 uM), MRSA (MIC>100 uM), B. subtilis (MIC 12.5 uM), and C.albicans (MIC>100 uM). Data conflict. Updated 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Iwakoshi-Ukena E, Soga M, Okada G, Fujii T, Sumida M, Ukena K.2011
Literature Information.Title: Characterization of novel antimicrobial peptides from the skin of the endangered frog Odorrana ishikawae by shotgun cDNA cloning
